alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clermont; Clinton; Highland; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:59PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN CLERMONT, NORTHWESTERN BROWN, SOUTHEASTERN WARREN, SOUTHWESTERN CLINTON AND WEST CENTRAL HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 559 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Blanchester, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Blanchester, Lynchburg, Morrow, Woodville, Fayetteville, Midland, Butlerville, Pleasant Plain, St. Martin, State Route 123 at State Route 132, Chasetown, Middleboro, Dallasburg, Westboro, Edenton and Lake Lorelei. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
